alert.note: Alert for Forsyth; Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 4:06AM EST until February 06 at 1:52PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Big Creek near Alpharetta affecting Fulton and Forsyth Counties. For the Big Creek...including Alpharetta...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Big Creek near Alpharetta. * WHEN...Until early Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10 feet, Minor flooding expands along the creek from near Cumming to Alpharetta and Roswell. Backyards of homes off Seale Drive and Gunter Court and portions of the Golf of Georgia are under a foot of water. The Big Creek Greenway experiences significant flooding up to 4 feet deep with closure of the paths. This especially occurs upstream and downstream from the gage on Kimball Bridge Road and Rock Mill Park. A large portion of the YMCA Campground off Preston Ridge Road will be under a two feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM EST Friday the stage was 7.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 AM EST Friday was 7.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.7 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 7 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.7 feet on 01/11/1968. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
